column4: Hi my remote linux machine has trouble, it moutned read-only and fsck doesn't seem to work, any suggestions (Ubuntu 6.06) ?
What access do you have to it?
anything in a dmesg?
The ordered stuff is fine
anything else in the dmesg relating to the device ?
: http://rafb.net/paste/results/TGG2ih56.html
That all looks good
OK, if it is root then try a mount -o remount /
But it really depends what went wrong, you can force a reboot by   echo b > /proc/sysrq-trigger
Ah well - it is difficult to read its mind
Are all your partitions read only?
Is it serial console you have to this box or what? Do you have bios access?
wok?

It's difficult to know - without figuring out why it read-only'd it its difficult to guess what will happen; since you are screwed at the moment I think I'd probably force the reobot and hope for the best - but it really wouldn't surprise me if it stopped during boot
It normally read only mounts if there is a problem writing to the disc at some point
: server still not getting up
You killed it
better find someone near the reset button and the screen
yeah but doesnt have to be fast, server was just up and not being used YET
Ah - if it did a readonly then I'd give the disc a really good checkout before putting it into service
